description: A derivative of dialectal English brog (“sniggle, fish with a brog”), equivalent to brog +‎ -le. Compare brog (noun).

verbs.description: broggle (third-person singular simple present broggles, present participle broggling, simple past and past participle broggled)

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect) To sniggle, or fish with a brog.
examples: And as this way of fishing is called Sniggling, so it is called Broggling for Eels

entries.meaning: (dialectal) To poke around, especially poke around in a hole with a stick.
